decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number (s): Supporting Document "Lovelace House Existing Insulated Render", CLLH-HMA-ZZ-ZZ-D-A-1000 P01, CLLH-HMA-ZZ-ZZ-D-A-1001 P01, CLLH-HMA-ZZ-ZZ-D-A-2000 P01, CLLH-HMA-ZZ-ZZ-D-A-2001 P01, CLLH-HMA-ZZ-ZZ-D-Z-3000 P01, CLLH-HMA-ZZ-ZZ-D-A-3001 P01, CLLH-HMA-ZZ-ZZ-D-A-4000 P01, CLLH-HMA-ZZ-ZZ-D-A-4001 P01, Technical Report: External Fa√ßade Design received 11th August 2023, Cover Letter dated 14th June 2023, email "Cladding - Predicted Sound Insulation Value" from the Acoustic Consultant dated 10th August 2023.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The removal of existing cladding and installation of proposed cladding shall not reduce the acoustic performance of the existing building, i.e. the replacement cladding shall be of equal or greater acoustic performance to the existing cladding panels. The replacement of cladding and associated fire safety work shall not compromise standards of the Council's SPG10 and criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented accordingly and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
description: Application for a Non-Material Amendment in (S96a) seeking to allow replacement of the existing combustible insulated render system with non-combustible insulated render system. Replacement render to match existing in relation to planning permission reference of duplicate applications P/2003/3907 and P/2003/3936 dated 28/10/04 'P/03/3936 granted 28/10/2004 for re-development of existing department store to provide new building of two to seven stories (plus part lower ground floor) for replacement department store with integral coffee shop/restaurant on ground and mezzanine levels (3556sqm); 137 residential units; access, parking, servicing and landscaping (Duplicate Applications)'
